r.to: List of proprietary software for Linux

page.title: List of proprietary software for Linux

revisions.rev:
{{refimprove|list|date=August 2008}} {{cleanup|list|date=December 2010}}
Though [[Linux]] is an [[open-source]] [[operating system]] and usually comes bundled with [[free and open source software]], '''proprietary software for Linux''' does exist and is available to end-users.
The following is a list of proprietary software for Linux:
== Networking == ===Web Browser/s=== *[[Google Chrome]] — freeware, Google Chrome is a browser that combines a minimal design with sophisticated technology to make the web faster, safer, and easier (an open source version, [[Chromium (web browser)|Chromium]], also exists) *[[Netscape]] — freeware, last Linux version is 7.2 *[[Opera (web browser)|Opera]] — freeware, offers free and easy to download Web browsers for computers, mobile phones and devices.
=== E-mail Client in MS Outlook Style === *[[Bynari]] — Insight Family of products is a collaboration suite of products that consists of open source components and proprietary development, by Bynari, that runs on Linux. *[[Lotus Notes]] — 8.0.0 for Linux/x86 (Red Hat and SuSE initially)<ref>See [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/downloads/ls/lsndad/?S_TACT=105AGX28&S_CMP=TRIALS Lotus Notes 8.0 trial download]</ref> *[[Zarafa (software)|Zarafa Outlook Sharing]] Zarafa is designed to integrate with Microsoft Office Outlook and is meant as an alternative to the Microsoft Exchange Server. *[[Zimbra]] — Open source cross-platform webmail and Desktop client.
=== FTP Client/s === *IglooFTP PRO for Linux *Pro:Atria Ltd [[SFTPPlus]] commercial SSH server and client with additional audit and automation functions in order to meet regulatory and corporate compliance requirements. *[http://www.xellsoft.com/SynchronEX.html Xellsoft.com SynchronEX+] Shareware, SynchronEX enables robust multi-directional file tree synchronization and backup over local & network paths in any situation:
===Firewall (packet filtering)=== *[[SmoothWall]] Corporate — A closed fork of SmoothWall, targeted at enterprise and corporate users
=== Visual traceroute === *[[Traceroute#External links|VisualRoute]]
=== P2P File Sharing === *Loophole ([[WinMX]] protocol) — WinMX servers down since 09.2005. *MetaMachine [[eDonkey2000]] — latest release from 25.07.2005.
==="Hotline" P2P protocol clients/servers=== *GHX
=== Multifunction sound modem program/s === *PrimaFax
=== Fax software === *[[Esker Fax]] *[[Esker VSI-FAX]] *[[Fax2Send]] *FAXCOM *[[MessagePlus/Open]] *[[U-Fax]]
=== Network maintenance === *[[HP Openview]] [[HP Openview#Products|agents]]
=== Routing === *GateD
===[[Distributed Computing]]=== * [[Portable Batch System]] PBS Gridworks
== Desktop/System software == ===Work with files=== ==== Console Archiver/s ==== *[[RAR]]
====Desktop search==== *[[Clipardo]] *[[Google Desktop]] 1.0, released June 27, 2007
====File splitters==== * [http://www.hjsplit.org/linux/ HJSplit for Linux], also available on other platforms.
===[[PDF]] viewer=== *[[Adobe Systems]] [[Acrobat Reader]] *[[Foxit Software]] [[Foxit Reader]] *[[PDF Studio Pro]] *[[PDF Studio Standard]]
=== PDF Authoring === *Adobe [[Acrobat Distiller]]
===Cryptography=== *[[Pretty Good Privacy]]
=== Scanner utilities === *[[VueScan]] *[[Xvscan]] last updated in 2000<ref>http://www.tummy.com/xvscan/</ref>
=== Antivirus === *[[AntiVir]] Workstation PersonalEdition *[[Avast]] [[Anti-Virus]] *[[AVG Anti-Virus]] *[[BitDefender]] Antivirus Scanner for Unices *[[Dr. Web]] *[[F-Prot]] (not to be confused with F-Secure) *[[Kaspersky Anti-Virus]] *[[NOD32]] (server version) *[[RAV Antivirus]] *[[Trend Micro]] ServerProtect for Linux
=== Bootloading === *Acronis OS Selector
=== Hard disk partitioning === *[[Acronis PartitionExpert]] *[[Paragon Partition Manager]]
=== Backup software === *BRU Workstation/Desktop/Server, reliable backup software. [http://www.tolisgroup.com/products/software/] *[[EMC Legato Networker]] *Microlite BackupEDGE *[[Nero Linux]], popular CD burning software. [http://www.nero.com/enu/linux4.html] *SpiderOak Backup [https://spideroak.com] *www.Lonetar.com
===PIM / DB / Hierarchical notebook with tree view=== * [http://www.treepad.com/linux/treepadlite/ TreePad Lite]
== Multimedia == === Audio/Video === ====[[MP3]] Encoding==== *[[L3enc]] ====Score Writer==== *[[Guitar Pro]] ==== Multimedia Player ==== *[[Fluendo DVD Player]] *[[LinDVD]] *[[Minitube]] *[[Musictube]] *[[PowerDVD|PowerDVD for Linux]] (discontinued) *[[Real Player]]
=== Graphics === ==== Graphics viewers/editors ==== *[[CompuPic]] *[[Photobomb]] *[[Picasa]] 2.2, 2.7 and 3.0 beta (discontinued) *[[XnView MP]] *[[Xv]]
==== Professional Graphics Editors ==== *[[Corel]] [[Photo-Paint]] 9 (discontinued) *[[LightZone]] *[[Pixel32]]
==== Digital imaging ==== *[[Bibble (software)|Bibble]]
==== 2D Bitmap Animation and Paint ==== *[[TVPaint]]
==== Vector Graphics Editor/s ==== *[[Corel Draw]] 9 (discontinued)
==== Flash Player ==== * [[Adobe Systems|Adobe]] [[Flash Player]]
====3D Graphics==== *[[Houdini (software)|Houdini]] *[[Maya (software)|Maya]] *SoftImage XSI
=== Video, etc. === ==== Simple/Professional Video Production Environment ==== *[[Autodesk/Discreet Flint/Flame/Inferno]] *[[Autodesk/Discreet Smoke]] *[[IFX Piranha]] *[[iMira Editing]] *[[MainActor]]
==== Creation of 2D and 3D Effects ==== *[[Eyeon Fusion|Fusion]] *[[Nuke (software)|Nuke]] *[[Shake (software)|Shake]]
==== Miscellaneous ==== *[[Google Earth#Linux version|Google Earth]] *[[TrueCrypt]], the [[source code]] is available, but the license is considered "unclear" and therefore not considered "free" by some of the major GNU/Linux distributions<ref>[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=364034 Debian Bug report logs - #364034]. Accessed on: January 12, 2009.</ref><ref>[http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/distributions/2008-October/000276.html TrueCrypt licensing concern] Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref><ref>[https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/109701 Bug #109701 in Ubuntu]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref><ref>[http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-buildservice/2008-10/msg00055.html non-OSI compliant packages in the openSUSE Build Service]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref><ref>[http://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=241650 Gentoo bug 241650]. Accessed on: April 20, 2009</ref>, and even considered with "potential to be actively dangerous" by [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]]<ref>http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/ForbiddenItems#TrueCrypt</ref>

== Programming and development == ===[[C++]] [[Integrated development environment|IDEs]]=== *[[Code Crusader]] *[[CodeWarrior]] *[[KDE Studio Gold]] *[[Kylix (software)|Kylix]] *[[SlickEdit]] *[[TimeStorm]] *[[Understand for C++]]

== Servers == ===[[WWW]]=== *[[Abyss Web Server]] - original open source version is being developed as part of [[xmlrpc-c]] project now. *[[Adobe JRun]] *[[CGIProxy]] - source available for non-commercial use. *[[Zeus Technology|Zeus]] [[Zeus Web Server|Web Server]]
=== DB Engine === *[[IBM]] [[IBM DB2|DB2]] *[[Informix]] *[[Oracle database|Oracle]] *[[Sybase]] Adaptive Server Enterprise
=== E-mail / [[Personal information manager]] / [[Groupware]] Servers === *CommuniGate Pro *[http://www.bynari.net Bynari] *[[Lotus Domino]] *[[NetMail]] *[[Novell]] [[GroupWise]] *[[Open-Xchange]] *[[Scalix]] (based on HP OpenMail) *SCOoffice Mail Server *[http://www.teamware.com Teamware Office] *[http://www.zarafa.com Zarafa]
=== Product data/product lifecycle management ([[Product Data Management|PDM]]/[[Product Lifecycle Management|PLM]]) === *[[Teamcenter|Siemens Teamcenter]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.plm.automation.siemens.com/en_us/about_us/newsroom/press/press_release.cfm?Component=25352&ComponentTemplate=822|title=Teamcenter 2005 Delivers Comprehensive PLM Offering|date=2006-06-20|publisher=Siemens PLM Software|accessdate=2009-06-25}}</ref>
=== Proxy === * [[SafeSquid]] Content Filtering HTTP1.1 Proxy
=== Cluster Filesystems === *Matrix Server
=== [[Managed File Transfer]] === *[[Serv-U FTP Server|Serv-U File Server]] - Managed file transfer server, supporting [[FTP]], [[FTPS]], [[SSH File Transfer Protocol|SFTP]], [[HTTP]], and [[HTTPS]] file transfer methods as well as numerous other features.
==Miscellaneous applications== === Mathematics === *[[Magma computer algebra system|Magma]] *[[Maple (software)|Maple]] *[[Mathematica]] *[[MATLAB]]
===Statistical Packages=== *[[SPSS]] *[[Stata]] *[[TSP (econometrics software)|TSP]]
===3D Modelling=== *[[ProEngineer|Pro/ENGINEER]] Linux *[[NX (software)|Siemens NX]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.plm.automation.siemens.com/en_us/about_us/newsroom/press/press_release.cfm?Component=25399&ComponentTemplate=822|title=UGS Ships NX 4 and Delivers Industryâs First Complete Digital Product Development Solution on Linux|date=2009-04-04|accessdate=2009-06-20}}</ref>
===[[CAD]]/[[Computer-aided manufacturing|CAM]]/[[Computer-aided engineering|CAE]]=== *[[Bricscad | BricsCAD]] is an [[IntelliCAD]] based commercial CAD solution. *[[CATIA]] by [[Dassault SystÃ¨mes]] *[http://www.cycas.de/ CYCAS] by Verlag Frese *[[NX (software)|Siemens NX]] *[[QCAD]] professional is built on the QCAD opensource package. *[[VariCAD]]
=== Diagram and Chart Designing === *[[DataScene]] *[[Poseidon for UML]]

=== Game makers === *[http://maker3d.tk Maker3D] is a 3D RPG creator software *[http://tululoo.com Tululoo Game Maker] is a complex game creation environment
== Emulators == === Video game console emulators === * [[BoycottAdvance]] - [[Game Boy Advance]] emulator, freeware * [[ePSXe]] - [[Sony Playstation]] emulator, freeware * [[MAME]] - emulators for multiple arcade machines; source available for non-commercial use * [[Regen (emulator)|Regen]] - Sega Genesis / Mega Drive emulator
=== Virtual Machine Emulator === *[[Parallels Workstation]] *[[QuickTransit]] *[[VMware Workstation]] *[[VMware Player]] *[[VMware vCenter Converter]] *[[VirtualBox]] (before version 4.x there was a closed-source edition, but now there is only one edition, and is open-source) *[[Win4Lin]] (discontinued and unmaintained)
===Windows Compatibility Layer=== *[[Cedega (software)|Cedega]] Windows games compatibility layer (Cedega is based on the [[Free software|free]] compatibility layer [[Wine (software)|Wine]].) *[[CrossOver]] (Crossover is based on the [[Free software|free]] compatibility layer [[Wine (software)|Wine]].)
==See also== *[[Wine (software)]], a "compatibility layer" that allows many windows software to run on Linux (both proprietary and free) * [http://lin-app.com/ Lin-App] A free, categorized and tagged on-line information service of various commercial applications and games for Linux.
